title: 105_hr120
content:
The Act titled "Bankruptcy Law Technical Corrections Act of 1997" makes amendments to definitions in Section 101 of title 11, United States Code. It includes changes to various paragraphs and the redesignation of paragraphs in numerical sequence. Additionally, there is an adjustment of dollar amounts outlined in Section 3. SEC. 3. ADJUSTMENT OF DOLLAR AMOUNTS. Section 104 of title 11, United States Code, is amended by inserting ``522(f)(3),'' after ``522(d),'' each place it appears. SEC. 4. EXTENSION OF TIME. Section 108(c)(2) of title 11, United States Code, is amended by striking ``922'' and all that follows through ``or'', and inserting ``922, 1201, or''. SEC. 5. PENALTY FOR PERSONS WHO NEGLIGENTLY OR FRAUDULENTLY PREPARE BANKRUPTCY PETITIONS. Section 110(j)(3) of title 11, United States Code, is amended by striking ``attorney's'' and inserting ``attorneys' ''. SEC. 6. ELIGIBILITY TO SERVE AS TRUSTEE. Paragraphs (1) and (2) of section 321(a) of title 11, United States Code, are amended by striking ``7, 12,'' and inserting ``12''. SEC. 7. EMPLOYMENT OF PROFESSIONAL PERSONS. SEC. 7. EMPLOYMENT OF PROFESSIONAL PERSONS. Amends Section 327 of title 11, United States Code, regarding the authority of the Trustee and limitations on compensation. Amends Section 328(b) by specifying the type of professional services that can be rendered. SEC. 6. LIMITATION ON COMPENSATION OF PROFESSIONAL PERSONS. Amends Section 328(a) of title 11, United States Code, to include compensation on a fixed or percentage fee basis. SEC. 7. COMPENSATION TO OFFICERS. Amends Section 330(a) by expanding compensation eligibility. SEC. 8. SPECIAL TAX PROVISIONS. Amends Section 346(g)(1)(C) by removing specified text. SEC. 9. EFFECT OF CONVERSION. Amends Section 348(f)(2) by clarifying property ownership. SEC. 10. AUTOMATIC STAY. SEC. 11. EXECUTORY CONTRACTS AND UNEXPIRED LEASES. Section 362 of title 11, United States Code, is amended to address security interests and entities. Section 365 of title 11, United States Code, is amended to include provisions related to penalty rates in contracts and default arising from nonmonetary obligations. Subsections (c) and (d) are also revised, with paragraph (4) being removed. Subsection (f)(1) is modified to end with a period. SEC. 12. AMENDMENT TO TABLE OF SECTIONS.

Amends the item for section 556 regarding contractual rights to liquidate commodities contracts or forward contracts.

SEC. 13. ALLOWANCE OF ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES.

Amends section 503(b)(4) of title 11, inserting references to subparagraphs before paragraph (3).

SEC. 14. PRIORITIES.

Amends section 507(a) of title 11, making punctuation changes in paragraph (3)(B) and adding "unsecured" after "allowed" in paragraph (7).

SEC. 15. EXEMPTIONS. SEC. 15. EXEMPTIONS.

Amends Section 522 of title 11, United States Code, by specifying changes in subsection (f)(1)(A)(ii)(II) and subsection (g)(2). SEC. 16. EXCEPTIONS TO DISCHARGE. Amends Section 523 of title 11, United States Code by adding exceptions related to debts owed to a spouse, former spouse, or child of the debtor, and specifying changes in subsection (a)(3), (a)(15), and (a)(17). SEC. 17. EFFECT OF DISCHARGE. SEC. 17. EFFECT OF DISCHARGE. Amends Section 524(a)(3) of title 11, United States Code by specifying changes related to discharge under sections 523, 1228(a)(1), or 1328(a)(1) of this title. SEC. 21. Amends Section 550(c) of title 11, United States Code regarding the liability of transferee of avoided transfer. It clarifies the recovery process from a transferee that was not an insider at the time of the transfer. Also, makes a conforming amendment to Section 547(b) of title 11, United States Code.

SEC. 22. Amends Section 553(b)(1) of title 11, United States Code by updating the reference from "362(b)(14)" to "362(b)(17)" for setoff purposes. SEC. 23. DISPOSITION OF PROPERTY OF THE ESTATE.

Section 726(b) of title 11, United States Code, is amended by striking "1009,".

SEC. 24. GENERAL PROVISIONS.

Section 901(a) of title 11, United States Code, is amended by inserting "1123(d)," after "1123(b),".

SEC. 25. APPOINTMENT OF ELECTED TRUSTEE. SEC. 25. APPOINTMENT OF ELECTED TRUSTEE.

Section 1104(b) of title 11, United States Code, is amended to allow for the appointment of an elected trustee by the United States trustee upon certification of the election by creditors. Any disputes regarding the election shall be resolved by the court. Section 1170(e)(1) of title 11, United States Code, is amended by striking ``section 11347'' and inserting ``section 11326(a)''. Section 1172(c)(1) is also amended in a similar manner. Section 1226(b)(2) is amended by changing references to other sections. Subsections (a) and (c) of section 1228 are amended. Section 1322 is amended in subsections (b) and (e). SEC. 31. DISCHARGE. Amends Section 1328(a) of title 11, United States Code, regarding exceptions to dischargeable debts. SEC. 32. BANKRUPTCY CASES AND PROCEEDINGS. Amends Section 1334(d) of title 28, United States Code, regarding bankruptcy case proceedings. SEC. 33. BANKRUPTCY REVIEW COMMISSION. Amends Section 604 of the Bankruptcy Reform Act of 1994. SEC. 34. KNOWING DISREGARD OF BANKRUPTCY LAW OR RULE. SEC. 34 amends Section 156(a) of title 18, United States Code, regarding knowing disregard of bankruptcy law or rule. It specifies the terms 'bankruptcy' and 'document' and updates references to title 11. SEC. 35 states the effective date and application of the amendments made by this Act to cases under title 11 of the United States Code.
